definition:
A **Fredholm equation of the first kind** is an integral equation of the
form $$\int_{a}^{b} K(x,y) f(y) dy = g(x), \quad \forall x \in [a,b],$$
and a **Fredholm equation of the second kind** is an integral equation
of the form
$$f(x) - \lambda\int_{a}^{b} K(x,y)f(y)dy = g(x), \quad \forall x \in [a, b],$$
where $$Kf(x) = \int_{a}^{b} K(x,y)f(y)dy, \quad \forall x \in [a, b]$$
is a compact operator in some function space.
